## ğŸ“ˆ RÃ©sultat 1 : PrÃ©valence des Facteurs {background-color="#27ae60"}

```{r prevalence-plot}
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 7

if(exists("dataset_score")) {
  dataset_score %>%
    select(sexe_risque, richesse_risque, educ_mere_risque,
           milieu_risque, age_mere_risque, ordre_risque,
           intervalle_risque, taille_menage_risque) %>%
    summarise(across(everything(), ~sum(., na.rm = TRUE))) %>%
    pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = "Facteur", values_to = "N") %>%
    mutate(
      Pct = N / nrow(dataset_score) * 100,
      Facteur = factor(Facteur, 
                       levels = c("sexe_risque", "richesse_risque", "educ_mere_risque",
                                 "milieu_risque", "age_mere_risque", "ordre_risque",
                                 "intervalle_risque", "taille_menage_risque"),
                       labels = c("Sexe masculin*", "PauvretÃ©", "Faible Ã©duc.",
                                 "Rural", "Ã‚ge mÃ¨re", "Rang â‰¥4",
                                 "Espacement", "MÃ©nage >7"))
    ) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = reorder(Facteur, Pct), y = Pct)) +
    geom_col(aes(fill = Pct), alpha = 0.8, width = 0.7) +
    geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Pct, 0), "%")), 
              hjust = -0.1, size = 5, fontface = "bold") +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_fill_gradient(low = "#ffa07a", high = "#dc143c") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15)), 
                       labels = percent_format(scale = 1),
                       limits = c(0, 70)) +
    labs(
      title = "PrÃ©valence des Facteurs de Risque",
      x = NULL,
      y = "% d'enfants exposÃ©s"
    ) +
    theme_minimal(base_size = 16) +
    theme(
      legend.position = "none",
      plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 20),
      panel.grid.major.y = element_blank(),
      axis.text.y = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold")
    )
}
```

::: {.callout-important}

## ğŸ“‰ RÃ©sultat 4 : Gradient Socio-Ã©conomique {.smaller}

```{r gradient-richesse}
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 6


if(exists("dataset_score")) {
  dataset_score %>%
    group_by(richesse_cat) %>%
    summarise(
      score_moyen = mean(score_tdah, na.rm = TRUE),
      ic_inf = score_moyen - 1.96 * sd(score_tdah, na.rm = TRUE) / sqrt(n()),
      ic_sup = score_moyen + 1.96 * sd(score_tdah, na.rm = TRUE) / sqrt(n())
    ) %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = richesse_cat, y = score_moyen, group = 1)) +
    geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = ic_inf, ymax = ic_sup), alpha = 0.2, fill = "steelblue") +
    geom_line(size = 2, color = "steelblue") +
    geom_point(size = 6, color = "darkred") +
    geom_text(aes(label = round(score_moyen, 1)), 
              vjust = -1.5, size = 6, fontface = "bold") +
    scale_y_continuous(limits = c(15, 45), expand = expansion(mult = 0.05)) +
    labs(
      title = "Score TDAH selon la Richesse",
      subtitle = "Gradient socio-Ã©conomique net et significatif",
      x = "Quintile de richesse",
      y = "Score moyen (IC 95%)"
    ) +
    theme_minimal(base_size = 16) +
    theme(
      plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 20),
      axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 20, hjust = 1, size = 12)
    )
}
```

## Annexe : Formule du Score {.smaller background-color="#95a5a6"}

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Score TDAH} &= 100 \times \Big[ \\
&\quad 0.15 \times \text{Ã‚ge mÃ¨re risque} \\
&+ 0.10 \times \text{Rang} \geq 4 \\
&+ 0.15 \times \text{Intervalle} < 24\text{m} \\
&+ 0.20 \times \text{PauvretÃ© Q1-Q2} \\
&+ 0.15 \times \text{Faible Ã©duc.} \\
&+ 0.10 \times \text{MÃ©nage} > 7 \\
&+ 0.10 \times \text{Rural} \\
&+ 0.15 \times \text{Sexe masculin*} \\
\Big]
\end{aligned}
$$

*LimitÃ© Ã  3% de l'Ã©chantillon
